entries.title: Netflix beats expectations with 230 million subscribers as co-founder Reed Hastings steps down
entries.description: Netflix’s subscriber growth is surging again, providing an early sign that its shift to include ads in a cheaper version of its video streaming service is helping to combat tougher competition and attract cost-conscious customers grappling with inflation.

entries.title: US Supreme Court fails to find source of abortion opinion leak
entries.description: After an extensive eight-month investigation and multiple interviews of certain court employees, the court said on Thursday 'the team has to date been unable to identify a person responsible by a preponderance of the evidence.'

entries.title: The incredible odyssey of photographer Erwin Blumenfeld
entries.description: The Museum of the Art and History of Judaism in Paris presents the captivating story of German artist Erwin Blumenfeld, who overcame the challenges of war and exile to become a renowned fashion photographer.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia provides first funding for French movie
entries.description: After having co-financed 170 feature movies from Africa and the Arab world, the Red Sea Film Foundation is now supporting a French feature –acclaimed director Maïwenn's new movie, featuring Johnny Depp.

entries.title: Scholz details acceleration of Germany's energy transition at Davos
entries.description: The German chancellor, the only leader of a G7 country present at the World Economic Forum, presented his plan on Wednesday in Switzerland.

entries.title: Alec Baldwin to be charged with involuntary manslaughter over fatal shooting on 'Rust' set
entries.description: The film’s armorer overseeing weapons will also be charged with involuntary manslaughter in 2021 shooting.

entries.title: US Treasury takes 'extraordinary measures' to avoid looming default as Congress seeks deal
entries.description: The Treasury Department said in a letter to congressional leaders it has started the emergency procedure as the government has run up against its legal borrowing capacity, or debt ceiling, of $31.4 trillion.

entries.title: In Peru, the large demonstration that began in the Andes reaches Lima
entries.description: The protesters are calling for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte and for constitutional reform.

entries.title: Pension reform: 'The government's satisfaction contrasts with the general feeling among the French'
entries.description: The wide gap between public perception and the government's vision raises questions over the method that was used to get to this outcome, writes Audrey Tonnelier in her column.

entries.title: Israel: Netanyahu government challenged by the Supreme Court
entries.description: Ultra-Orthodox Minister Aryeh Deri, convicted of tax fraud, will have to leave the government, after a decision from the country's top court.

entries.title: UN delegation visits Afghanistan to sway Taliban
entries.description: UN officials are expected to convey widespread indignation caused by recent Taliban measures curtailing women's rights and could travel to Kandahar in the hope of meeting Mullah Akhundzada', the country's supreme leader.

entries.title: Australian Open: Caroline Garcia is determined to win her first Grand Slam
entries.description: The number 4 seed from Lyon, who qualified for the third round on Thursday, is one of the favorites of the tournament. This French player has set her sights on winning her first Grand Slam title of the season.

entries.title: Second NBA game in Paris hopes to be a slam dunk for basketball's growth in Europe
entries.description: In addition to interest in the sport across the Atlantic, European sports leagues are taking note of how the NBA has innovated to grow its base of committed fans.

entries.title: On pensions, Macron has often contradicted himself
entries.description: Six years after saying it would be hypocritical to extend the retirement age, the French president is now trying to convince people that this measure is vital. But some of his opponents have also been inconsistent.

entries.title: Pension reform strikes: United, France's trade unions want to see how far they can go
entries.description: France's eight main trade unions and five youth movements have called on the French to march and strike against the government's pension reform.

entries.title: Iranian artist Shirin Neshat faces backlash from her country's protest movement
entries.description: Social media is abuzz about a new video by the exiled artist, but some opponents of the regime don't recognize themselves in her vision of the Iranian woman's body.

entries.title: Messi and Ronaldo meet again as Saudi Arabia flexes soft power through football
entries.description: Al Nassr signing Cristiano Ronaldo in late 2022 represents the kingdom's biggest coup in its sports outreach strategy. On Thursday, he will play in a friendly match against Lionel Messi's PSG.

entries.title: Macron believes his surprise at speed of climate change was 'misunderstood'
entries.description: French President Emmanuel Macron had been lambasted for rhetorically asking: Who could have predicted the climate crisis?

entries.title: In the United States, a culture war is simmering on gas stoves
entries.description: The controversy was ignited by two Democratic politicians who, in December 2022, asked a commission to examine the health risks posed by methane emissions from these cooking appliances.

entries.title: Sweden pledges to send Archer artillery to Ukraine
entries.description: Sweden's announcement comes a day before the US convenes a meeting of around 50 countries –  including all 30 members of the NATO alliance –  in Germany to discuss military aid to Ukraine.

entries.title: Algeria frees activist after promise to quit politics
entries.description: Opposition figure Rachid Nekkas was released on 'humanitarian grounds.'

entries.title: After Ivorian soldiers held in Mali were released, story behind the crisis comes to light
entries.description: The imprisoned soldiers in Mali were at the heart of a broader entanglement involving regional politics and gold trafficking.

entries.title: French strikes against pension reform bring trains, buses, schools to halt
entries.description: For the first time in 12 years, French labor unions have unanimously called for a day of strikes. Police are expecting 550,000 to 750,000 protesters nationwide.

entries.title: Macron travels to Spain to sign friendship deal as France goes on strike
entries.description: The one-day summit in Barcelona comes on a day of widespread strikes in France against Macron’s bid to increase the minimum retirement age from 62 to 64.

entries.title: Actor Julian Sands missing in Southern California mountains
entries.description: Sands, 65, was reported missing Friday on a trail on Mount Baldy.

entries.title: Ukraine opens investigation into helicopter crash that killed 14, including interior minister
entries.description: Denys Monastyrsky, 42, was killed along with two members of his office in a helicopter crash on Wednesday next to a kindergarten near Kyiv. According to preliminary findings, the cause of the accident could be fog.

entries.title: Hong Kong to scrap isolation rule for new Covid-19 cases
entries.description: After the rule, which requires people who test positive for Covid-19 to isolate at home for a minimum of five days, is scrapped the mask mandate will be the only major Covid-19 restriction left in the city.

entries.title: Pension reform strikes: Macron takes on the streets
entries.description: The first day of strikes against the government's pension reform, on Thursday, will be watched closely by the French president.

entries.title: Why this French pension reform will not be the last
entries.description: The French government's projections do not go beyond 2030 as the effects of its project remain uncertain in the long term.

entries.title: French filmmaker Paul Vecchiali has died
entries.description: An icon of a cinema in rebellion who stayed partly in the shadows, the artist who had made melodrama his area of expertise has died at 92.

entries.title: Jacinda Ardern to step down as New Zealand prime minister
entries.description: The 40th prime minister of New Zealand declared on Thursday, January 18, she will be stepping down as the country's leader and will not contest this year’s general elections.

entries.title: After January 8, the hunt for Brazil's rioters continues on social media
entries.description: The Instagram account 'Contragolpe Brasil' – which posts the photos and names of suspected rioters – gained more than a million followers in a single week.

entries.title: In Nigeria, the city of Kano is at the heart of every electoral dispute
entries.description: With its 5.9 million registered voters, the country's second-largest city plays a key role in the presidential race, scheduled for February 25.
